description:
Best Cafe in Town!!! Thumbs up emoji x 100!!

Usually 3 things i look for when i try to critique a cafe. Ambiance, Taste, and service. All really good! I got vanilla bean latte, which was pretty damn good, and a caramel/butterscotch glazed cake/bread! It's displayed in the front of the cashier. That cake was just amazing. It tasted even better with the vanilla bean latte. I like it very much when my drink and pastry just blends in well! 

The owner was very friendly and so was the barista. I think its usually just the owner and one worker working together. I've been here twice. It also seemed like most of the customers here are regulars. 

As a tourist, i highly recommend coming here for a grab in the morning and find a bird (scooter) and go inside the golden gate park! It's what i did and remains as the favorite part of my trip!
author: Mike K.

description:
Cute little cafe in inner sunset!

This place is very tiny but super cute and well-decorated. I got small size Titanic II (mocha with homemade marshmallow $7ish) and it was amazing but pricey. I like how they came up with that name though! so unique and cute! My friend got matcha latte($4.50) and it was good but just average matcha latte to me. I've had better one elsewhere. I wish they have more seatings as they can get really crowded on weekends! Great place to chill and study on weekdays though.

It's worth a visit, but I don't think I will come here regularly.
author: Clare L.

description:
Omg those oatmeal caaaaaaaaaakes!!!!! Like what do they make them out of??? Lol

10/10 for cute points
5/5 for cutie points 
3/3 because Celeste is the best barista ever

I would subtract one star because my standards are sooooooo high but I just got out of Hot Yoga and am feeling p zen. I bestow it upon you with honor and a humble heart namaste
author: Pirouz M.

description: This cafe is small and cute. I loved the green exterior which definitely stood out as you walked by. I had the Matcha spiced latte with their homemade marshmallow. The drink sounds weird, but the combination of flavors paired beautifully. You can skip on the marshmallow, which was way too sweet.
author: Vy T.

description:
Love this small , charming cafe .
High quality beverages & wonderful baked goods .
Some new drink items , "the titanic "looks so good .
They have had an unusual and really amazing Oatmeal cake from a small bakery in San Jose , from when they first opened , so happy , they always stock it .it's unique, more like toasted coconut coffee cake , sort of ??
it reminds me of a pastry we have had in Hawaii , it's flavorful & scrumptious!
Today we had warm banana bread , omg ,
So good & a generous slice , plenty to share .
Check it out , just learning about back area seating , all the years , I never knew this .
Have to check that out .
Staff very accommodating, funny and just plain NICE !
author: Ellie O.

description:
Tiny coffee and tea spot with a few baked treats and empanadas for food. Super cute green painted front with a bench and inside a few tables and chairs to eat/drink/work at. Mostly a Local pop in for real coffee. My cold brew was strong but not acidic. My kids had a Chai Latte and Vanilla Bean Latte and I've never see them finish before me,but they did! That's how good it was. While in this neighbor there's some good food to be had and dumpling shopping nearby. Parking is metered but there's some construction that currently limits the spaces. 
This place can get busy but also chill back down quickly. Surprised to hear they have been there for 9 years already.
author: Lisa H.

description:
What started as a quick detour to grab a cup of coffee resulted in a pleasant distraction we did not regret having at all.

Real, tiny coffee shop that isn't hard to miss due to its rustic, modern SF look. I swear the storefront can look like the shed in the back of anybody's house but there's definitely more than meets the eye when you realize upon entry. The shop fits over what you'd expecting looking from the outside. Anyways, the coffee was a great pick me up, we decided to pick up the vanilla bean latte and the butterscotch latte. What stood out the most were their selection of sweets. I let temptation best me when I decided to nab one of their cashew cookies... It only led to regret in not grabbing my seconds first. Ah... I'll leave it at that.
author: David N.

description:
Dusty green storefront + cutest bench & florals. Interior-designers-owned cafe, w/ beautiful, hand-crafted woodworks, and rustic, earthly, minimalistic interiors, occasionally bouquets of fresh floral!! What a hidden gem in the outer sunset! 

- Impressive set of wooden designs: round coffee tables, menu frame, pastry counter, shelves, etc. And a delicately decorated, neatly organized space for pastries & coffee accessories. White rustic walls bring a whole new level of elegance & style!

- Homemade pound cakes, coffee cakes, sunflower seed cookies and more. Tasty, freshly baked, and w/ quality ingredients. Was always satisfied by their baked goods. 

- The signature Butterscotch latte is divine. The rich, creamy shot of butterscotch flavor adds to the bittersweet coffee. Matcha latte is also a personal favorite. A good balance of authentic green tea flavor + milk. 

- This place is a natural charm! It's petite yet unforgettable, and has lots to offer. Plenty of metered parking nearby & a local interior design store next door. 

- Customer service is above average. Although one time I did encounter a girl staff, rushing into closing store around 5:55 pm, and was aloof & unattentive to my questions. My experience during other visits are great though.
author: Jess W.

description:
This is a great spot to sit and escape from the craziness that is residency... if you just want to get away from everything, you should check out this adorable spot! It's so peaceful and you'll be able to enjoy a nice drink. 

My only complaint is that the benches in the back are very unstable. Yes, there's seating in the back! I love the rustic look but those benches have to be a safety hazard hahahahaa. I'm totally joking but I would prefer more comfy seats :P. 

I wanted a matcha latte but failed to realize they have a spiced matcha latte. But it was a pleasant surprise! It's a very nice level of spice and I would def get it again.
author: Janice H.

description:
TIME: Sunday @1pm

STAFF: Super nice

ATMOSPHERE:
This place is a LOT smaller than I expected! There's not much seating room, unless you don't mind being in the cave room in the back. The only "outdoor seating" they have are benches right or front.

WHAT I HAD:

LARGE FRENCH PRESS COFFEE - $4
Smooth tasting hot coffee. Can't complain!


MUSHROOM EMPANADA - $5.50
This place serves a variety of empanadas and I chose this one because of the ricotta cheese. It was quite tasty and quite small--which made it feel pricey. 

All the pastries at the cashier was exposed and I'm unsure how many people ordering had their saliva sprayed on them. I would prefer seeing them covered. 

As cute as this place may be, it's not a comfortable spot to sit and do work.  Some tables are too low and there is no wi-fi.
author: Tu-Anh N.

description: Great coffee drinks with Ritual Coffee. I particularly like the Spiced Matcha Latte. All the pastries are made in-house, which is amazing given what a small space it is. The front area has wonderful light, and there's another sitting area in the back. The service is always friendly. While I was nursing my crying baby, the batista brought me a extra cup of water with a straw. I guess he knows nursing moms need to stay hydrated!
author: Jessica E.

description:
Honestly I'm shocked at how someone can mess up latte art with 2% milk... I've seen photos of this place everywhere and it looked so cute! May have been the barista but I was highly disappointed. Not only that, but the latte itself just tasted like plain milk. 

Seating - very limited space which I didn't mind because it is sf. Only problem I had was how wobbly these tables are, saw previous reviews about this and I guess they never bothered to fix it.

Gave this place 2 stars because at least the food was good - I had the chamomile cupcake and the oatmeal cake. Didn't taste any chamomile in the cupcake but it wasn't bad. 

Not sure if I want to spend $20 again on two drinks and two pastries, but I guess this is sf haha
author: Chloe S.

description:
I am going to sound super childish, but I could not get over how cute and clever "The Titanic" was. It's literally the dark mocha but with a huge square marshmallow. With how pleased I was with this drink, I will definitely be back to try all of the other coffees. 

This coffee shop has to be one of my favorites. Maybe I came on a slow day, but the ambiance made me feel so comfortable and relaxed. There is a back area for extra seating but I chose to sit by the lit up windows and just people watched. Coffee gives me life by this coffee gave me life with a smile.
author: Denise I.

description: Came here this past weekend for a much needed dose of caffeine. It's a small rustic coffee shop. Limited seating. They have baked goods. I ordered a latte to go because there were no open seats. It would have been nice to sit down and people watch out the window. The latte was delicious. The milk was frothed perfectly smooth and velvety. No harsh acidic notes from the espresso. I want to come back to try their cold brew.
author: Edward N.

description:
When I got back from my semester abroad at the end of my junior year in college, I was an absolute nightmare for everyone around me. (Consider this Yelp review a belated apology.) One of my friends, who had just returned from her own stint abroad, was also pretty down in the dumps with reverse culture shock. We decided to vent to each other over a coffee break here, since we had heard Hollow was the epitome of minimalism with a more rustic IKEA vibe. I brought an IKEA catalog with me because I felt like we needed some European reading material to peruse.

I didn't study abroad in Sweden. And my friend wasn't even abroad in Europe.

Ah, the naiveté of youth! The vanilla bean latte was just warm and sweet enough to soothe my no-longer-abroad heart. My friend didn't have any complaints about her spiced matcha green tea latte. (She stayed on brand since she studied abroad in Japan.) The only other person there was on his laptop, trying to work in a coffee shop that didn't offer wifi, so in other words, he heard every word of our rant on the abominable American car culture.

Come here if you want to catch up with friends, not if you want to be productive, because you'll probably get distracted by a bunch of entitled millennials. Too bad they can't be thousands of miles away from you in some foreign country, huh?
author: Amy C.

description:
I had their vanilla bean latte and dark chocolate mocha. I was not very impressed with their coffee. It was very bland with a sprinkle of vanilla and dark chocolate, respectively.

Their pastries are good though. Their chocolate chip cookie and their chocolate chip biscuit are good.

It's also very expensive, so I probably wouldn't come here again.

The gentleman who helped us was very nice though.
author: Dee F.

description:
Delicious coffee and sweet little cafe. 
take your coffee to go, or stay if seats are available. note, their is very limited seating.
author: Danielle H.

description:
Cute coffee shop, but small place! I ordered an almond latte and my sister's ordered a vanilla
Latte. We both thought they were great and not too sweet. Not the most convenient place for sitting down since it's small, but if you're looking for a great grab and go this is the spot!
author: Sarah S.

description: Cute, little place for a quick caffeine fix. Their lattes are delicious and they also have handmade marshmallows! Perfect way to start out your day!
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
This is a very cute coffee shop in Inner Sunset. When you first walk in, you'll notice the intimate, rustic look of the space. It's not terribly big, so if you're looking for a study spot, I suggest going off-hours.

They serve Ritual Coffee, and charge by single or double espressos, which I appreciate as I think coffee shops should provide that option more. I'm not the biggest fan of Ritual beans, so the latte I ordered was okay. They also have delicious pastries. I didn't try any this time but they all looked super fresh and had a homey-baked feel to it.

The barista working the morning I went was friendly and helpful. The cost of the drinks is like any usual average priced place in SF. Like I mentioned, it is nice they adjust prices dependent on the number of espresso shots you get. Overall, lovely coffee shop and would come back again!
author: Jackie C.

description: Super cozy spot with friendly staff and yummy green tea lattes! Give it a try if you are in the area :)
author: Julianna D.

description:
What threw me off was one of the workers (might be the owner?) was incredibly rude to a person who came in & asked to have some creamer for her coffee. I understand why because they weren't a paying customer. The worker condescendingly said before you come into someone's coffee shop you shouldn't just come in to take someone else's creamer :) (yes, the smiley included) Would I have been annoyed if I had a coffee shop & someone did that to me? Probably. Would I act the same way as the worker? Nope. 

Other than that, coffee is decent. I actually recommend the empanadas more than the coffee.
author: Jenni D.

description: The cutest little coffee shop in the area! Came in here for an afternoon pick me up and loved the atmosphere. Unfortunately there's no WiFi but with good company and coffee, who needs to be on the internet. The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the iced almond milk latte was a little high at $6.24 rather than the usual $5.25 at other places.
author: Emily R.

description:
I found this place on Pinterest and it is as cute as it looks! We are visiting from out of town for our anniversary.

Ordered: americano, butterscotch almond milk latte 

Pros: I am a sucker for the exterior, light moss green, rustic sign, and cute writing on the window. I enjoyed the butterscotch, it's a unique flavor. The baristas were nice, and the owner was friendly. Parking is actually not that bad in the near by neighborhoods.

Cons: not much to say other then I would maybe like the butterscotch a little more sweet. 

I will totally go back!
author: Ceci F.

description:
Super cute little cafe. It has the expensive rustic chic look, and the price tag reflects that. The cafe is a couple blocks away from the super busy part of Irving, so parking is not too horrific. Because the place is small and with few tables, I wouldn't study in here. Usually, I just grab a coffee to go.

I typically get the iced butterscotch latte (~$5). It is sweet and rich. Just the way I like my coffee.  I haven't tried any of their baked goods, but the cookies are always tempting. Maybe one day when I'm really splurging. If anything, their paper straws are super cute, but don't savor your drink for too long or the straw starts to dissolve into the drink.
author: Kim W.

description:
Was near Twin Peaks and was looking for a coffee shop with good Espresso drinks. That's when I discovered Hollow. 

It's a cute, rustic, charming, and unassuming coffee shop with this rustic minimalist aesthetic. Hollow is down the street from Andronico's Market. Its kind of like Platform 9 and 3/4. If you're not looking for it, you wouldn't find it.

I loved the fact that it's one of the only cafes I've been to in SF that can make a soy flat white. Would definitely go again to escape and take a coffee break.
author: Brian L.

description: I have not been to France, but I suspect this is what a French cafe feels like. My daughter loves coffee and wants to try every coffee place we can and due to road construction, we almost passed on this one, but I'm glad we didn't. My daughter ordered an iced mocha and I had a chocolate croissant and an ice water. Both drinks were served in mason jars which I absolutely loved. Her mocha and my croissant were lovely as was the service. Find it and enjoy your time here like we did.
author: Rachel W.

description:
NO WIFI!!! This is one of those places where you have to actually talk to people. I'm all about study spots, and camping out with a laptop.. And Hollow was not a prime campsite for me. Don't get me wrong, its cute and rustic. It's probably the size of a hallway. Seating is very limited to 3 tables and an uncomfortable wooden bench. The tables are so short that I found myself slumping over my laptop while typing.

What really attracted me to this place was seeing that they have a house made vanilla bean latte. Coffee and vanilla are my two favorite past times, so I was set on trying the vanilla bean latte after seeing this on the menu. It sounded better than it tasted, i'm afraid. Since the price point was a bit steep, I expected something a bit more outstanding. Okay fine.. It's a latte with vanilla bean.. Simple ingredients. The texture was buttery and smooth and specs of vanilla bean harmoniously blended with the espresso. It was alright. Nothing too crazy though. I instantly downed my cup in less than 5 minutes because I needed to get out of there. No wifi and an endless amount of work on my laptop do not go well together. 

Hollow -- you're cute and all but I wouldn't categorize this as a study spot. Maybe for an intimate date. I'll have to bring my boyfriend next time.
author: Rachelle Y.

description:
Hollow is a neighborhood gem. Although the place itself is quite small, the coffee is big on flavor. 

I had the spiced matcha latte with a marshmallow. The latte had a pleasant amount of spice; kind of subtle. The marshmallow was huge! It's so big that you have to order a large if you want the marshmallow. It gradually melted a bit and added some sweetness to the latte. 

I knocked off a star (wish I could do 1/2 star) because a couple of the tables were really wobbly and lopsided. Parking wasn't too bad and service was pretty good.
author: Rose A.

description: This spiced matcha latte was one of the best I've ever had (& I have high standards for matcha!). Barista was very sweet too. Lovely little hidden gem.
author: Yasmine S.

description:
At first glance when you see this cafe you think it's small since you see a long bench with tables that fit 8-10 people in the front; however there is a hallway that leads to another room which can hold more people then you expect. 

Was stopping by for my morning coffee and decided to try this place out by recommendation of my boyfriend. Quaint place with a menu that is written with a marker. The environment is a calm peaceful environment that has the typical coffee shop music. When walking in the person making the coffee instantly greets you and was very polite and kind. They have not only coffee, but a hot chocolate called the titantic with a giant marshmallow to represent the ice berg. Very cool. 

They will bring the coffee to you which is pretty neat and unique compared to other coffee shops. The vanilla bean latte was actually pretty good and I am usually picky about my lattes. It is actually on the same level as the coffee shop I usually go to called Artís so bravo. 

I overall like this place and would definitely come back if I'm ever in the area. Give this place a chance and see what I am talking about.
author: Nadine Y.

description: Service was excellent. The barista was very sweet and nice to every customer that came in. Coffee was just ok. I'm all about supporting the locals. However, $5.50 for a latte is overpriced for me. There are so many coffee shops in the area that charge around $4 for a latte.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
OHMYGODTHISPLACEISSOCUTE.

It's like a little old secret hallway. Old and chic and cool yet refined and pretty and awesome and wow.

Espresso-Ritual. On point. Delicious.

Cappuccino with Vanilla Bean- yeah it's like a mini super foamy latte. The vanilla bean syrup is sooooooooo tasty..... all the specs of the cappuccino were on point too.

Dope baristas.
Great baked goods.
Cutest little spot everrrrrrrrr.
I have to stop writing about it or I'll write "cute" infinitely.
Go there once in your life. Haha. It's practically out of a movie. It's better than The Mystery Spot.
author: Michelle C.

description: It is relatively small however, really charming! I had their iced vanilla bean latte which was delicious. It's a perfect place to sit down and read or journal!
author: Deyanira O.

description:
I stopped by this cozy cafe for a quick tea on a typical, cloudy afternoon. Seating is limited and lining up for drinks necessitates some squeezing around the milk bar, but the interior is calm and inviting. Or so I thought.

I got a matcha tea latte and my partner got a loose leaf tea latte. My drink was delicious, with nice warming spices and just enough grassy flavor from the matcha. My partner's tea latte was not so great and mostly tasted of warm milk (even after 20 minutes of steeping). We were sad that the simple drink was such a big miss.

In addition to the sad drink, one of the main reasons I'm docking stars is due to the conversation the employees were having. I'm just wondering, was it really necessary for then to go on a very loud and very extended diatribe about how sexual assault claims are "overblown" these days? Is it really necessary to claim that a woman could have been paid off to come forward about sexual harassment? And is it really necessary for employeed to describe in detail a woman's sexual harassment claim, only to then dismiss it because she "could have left"? If these are your opinions, do they need to be shared so loudly at work when there are lots of patrons? It made the atmosphere go from cozy and welcoming to "wtf."

Anyway, reader, you may not find this kind of talk unpleasant, and I'm sure not every employee at Hollow feels the same compunction to share their views about sexual assault so loudly. If you happen to come in on a quieter, less controversial day, I highly recommend the matcha latte. Hard pass on the loose leaf tea latte though.
author: Leah T.

description: Cute spot on Irving. I've stopped here a few times. The space isn't big so if you plan on doing some work here you or planning on hanging out with friends I would suggest getting here early or later in the day. It's a charming cafe with lots of fun drinks and homemade marshmallows (yum). There is also a great selection of pastries and chocolates. If you have time to kill or while you are waiting for your drink there is a back room that has cool knick knacks to purchase.
author: Shristi R.

description:
Just on the cuteness factor alone , this place gets five stars. Hollows got all sorts of personality inside and out !  You can't help but be charmed by Its very cozy and rustic decor.  

HOllow is certainly small in size, but it's big on its coffee craft know how.  They use quality Ritual beans and take care in making delicious and satisfying coffee drinks. I really enjoyed my butter scotch latte ! It was well balanced and rich in flavor .  Excellent.
author: Brenda B.

description:
This cafe had a Scandinavian feel. Quaint, cozy, minimal, simple, rustic decor. I liked it. 

They offered some baked goods which looked visually appealing but I'm not sure I'd personally buy for hygienic reasons being that they're too out in the open and right under the customers within their reach. I wouldn't know if it's been coughed on, touched or god knows what. Viewing the photos they had them covered in glass but that was not the case the other day, unfortunately because their scones looked great. 

The staff wasn't overly friendly which I will personally prefer over too much small talk or too chatty. But I will point out when we first arrived to the front, I didn't know whether they were ready to take my order or if I should sit down and wait until the two finished up their little chat. This appears to be the norm here based on the numerous reviews although some claims of rudeness were a bit dramatic. 

But coffee was better than decent. I certainly didn't hate it.
author: Esther A.

description: A super tiny and cute place with nice lattés. My stepdaughter and I both had the matcha latté and enjoyed them. Vibe from counter staff was a bit uptight, but I didn't really care; we were in our own little bubble.
author: Camille L.

description: Literally cannot get any cuter when it comes to a coffee joint. It's a portal into fairyland. It's close to the library too which is a plus for us nerds. Definitely worth a trip to the sunset for anyone coming from a distance. Sit and take in the atmosphere then head to ocean beach.
author: Megan C.

description:
I love this cafe. It's aesthetically pleasing to the eyes! I come here usually after I have class at SFSU for a coffee break! Depending on the time- parking can be a little tricky. It's street meter parking (it's SF, what do you expect!) in front. 

What I've ordered from Hollow: Spiced Matcha Latte (yum!), regular latte, vanilla bean latte. Their cookies and treats look delicious but I've never tried them myself.

If you're looking for good coffee, a place to catch up with a friend, or a place to fill your Instagram with pretty pictures, go here! :)
author: Krystal S.

description:
The espresso drinks are good and the staff are mostly friendly, but they do not understand service; They are often very busy and forget to acknowledge customers when they come in. I have stood in line for up to 10 minutes with zero acknowledgement from staff. They should say hello and tell you what is going on, like "we will be right with you". 

My two main complaints are their hours and, for some reason, they do not offer non fat milk for the 20+ million Americans who should only drink non fat milk. Their hours are a joke for a coffee house. They open at 8 AM on weekdays and 9 AM on weekends. uuuuum, most people are already at work or school by 8:00. I bet they lose more than half their business because they are not open when people get coffee. I have three roommates who all drink coffee and all have to be at work by 8:00, so they must walk past the closed Hollow and go to the Beanery to get morning coffee.
author: Warren S.

description:
Such a cute and intimate coffeeshop.

Hole in the wall place. Very few seating. Nice chill atmosphere, dimly lit lights.

Only one worker/barista was there which was cool.

Menu is straightforward.

For here/to go option

Ordered the spiced green tea latte and the titanic two. Pricey but good quality. Very delicious. Not too sweet or artificial taste. Cute latte art.
author: Michele G.

description: Cute little coffee shop in the middle of a mostly residential neighbourhood. I think it was in a converted garage. The drinks were good (I just had a standard black Americano coffee and had a taste of one of the lattes, but unfortunately I forget which one at the moment). The tables and seats by the window look fab, especially on a beautiful day. However, if they're all full don't despair - there's more seating in the back, where it's quieter and tucked away from the sun.
author: Bianca C.

description:
This little spot could not be more aptly named. It's a small, green, tucked away oasis. Nothing is "too fancy," but everything is special (and hand-made, and delicious). 

You might be inclined to shy away from a flavored latte (butterscotch or vanilla), if you're used to how sweet and fake they typically taste ... but not here! There is something magical about the made-in-house flavors, as well as the balanced spiciness of the matcha latte or chai. I haven't tried their hot chocolate yet, but it's on my list.

You can also get tasty pastries and breakfast empanadas ... yum.
author: Catie F.

description: Salute to that lady for rocking it in a busy afternoon alone.. a lot of customers, very long line, tables were all filled.. lovely drinks and pastries.. great find
author: Ar-ef F.

description:
..a place for people who like posting Instagram photos of lates more than the taste of them.. 

This is a quaint little neighbourhood coffee shop which offers basic options for coffee, espresso and freshly baked goods. Hipster workers, hipster music, and hipster decor  accomplishes a "meh" overall feeling. I've been here a couple of times and it's left a bit to be desired. 

Walking in the door, I wasn't greeted or even acknowledged. I read the menu and patiently waited a few minutes for the barista to finish talking to another customer. When she turned to me she didn't smile or give any welcoming presence. 

My laté was borderline cold and the "house butterscotch" was pretty much non-existent. The croissant I ordered was small and a bit dry.

Overall, I give the place a 3.. positive points for the cute exterior, nice use of space, and a no-fuss cup of coffee in the Sunset neighborhood. Lost points for taste and customer service.
author: Cynthia P.

description: Espresso game is epic, Baristars are super nice. Not the place for fast coffee or Starbuck knock off drinks. A truly great café.
author: Bryan M.

description:
The quality of the coffee here is awesome. We were originally going to Home but the line was crazy and there was no parking so I pulled up my handy dandy Yelp app and found this gem.

Only downside is that this place is tinyyyy, it was super hard to get a table and we kinda camped until someone left but super worth it because the coffee is delicious here!

I got the vanilla bean latte and I downed it. It was not too sweet and just the right amount of coffee to milk ratio. The vanilla bean was so good, I literally ran my spoon along the sides of my empty cup to collect all of the remaining cream and vanilla bean. 

My fiancé had the titanic and it looked amazing. It was basically a hot chocolate with shots of espresso and a giant marshmallow floating in the middle like the titanic ice berg. 

This place trumps Home in terms of quality of coffee. If you care about the taste, quality and amount of caffeine in your coffee, definitely come here instead of Home.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Who knew you could find a cafe on Irving St? I found this place by accident, but nonetheless, I was content by their service and coffee. The only down side to this place is the narrowness of the shop. There is LIMITED seating here and at best, you can only fit 8 people comfortably in the cafe. So its either a hit or miss in terms of finding a seat to chit chat with some friends.

I order a small latte and the cup was good. Not too much foam and sweetness was on point. I wish I could come back here to try some of their other signature coffees, but their space issue is a big problem b/c you can get uncomfortable and squished really easily.

When I was sitting down, one of the clumsy baristas dropped a metal bowl or something and it made a loud ass sound that disturbed everyone's conversation. I'm sorry, but this place is just too small to actually be an enjoyable experience.

I would definitely say this place is meant for a pit stop for people, but there is also some kinda of artisan kitchen store ware right next door that people can check out as well.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
UPDATE: I stand by my original 1 star rating. Their coffee and service are terrible. I tried to give this place a second chance and I was just as disappointed as the first time.

When I asked for a Medium size, the server said they ran out of Medium cups. They didn't offer the Large size at a medium price since they ran out of that cup size. How the hell do you run out of cups at a coffee shop? 

When I received the coffee there really was nothing special about it. I got a latte and all I could taste was milk. There was nothing special about their coffee despite their high prices compared to other competitors in the area. I've had better coffees from McDonalds for a fraction of the price.

I will never give this place my business again. Worst coffee shop in SF.
author: Chelsea Y.

description: coffee in an aeroplane over the sea would taste like hollow and I bought that record the day it came out and I was already old then and way old now so I get it and r&b kid in the white t-shirt I love that band practice was great I really do I remember but you're harshing the whole check-your-devices-at-the-door-and-talk-to-your-neighbor vibe when I have to 1) wait many (many (many)) minutes just hoping to show up on your map or b) be that um-excuse-me-but-could-I-get-a-little-help-here middle-aged guy that i am/am not/fear so instead I none-of-the-above it to star buck's for a tallcap that takes like death.
author: Patrick C.

description:
A wonderful friend and fellow coffee lover suggested we try this place out while we were in the golden gate park area! We stopped by here before breakfast for something warm and sweet. The store is such a nice quaint space. It's small and intimate, and the baristas are friendly and helpful to new customers! 

I tried their regular latte, their cinnamon bun biscuit, and their banana bread on my first visit. The latte was absolutely delicious! Their espresso has a strong rich flavor that isn't too bitter or overwhelming. It's perfect without adding anything, and compliments their pastries well! I can't rave about how much I loved their little treats. I hope they're made fresh in house! They even warm up your pastry for you in a little toaster oven if you want it hot! 

The next day I couldn't help but come back, it was so good! I didn't get a pastry this time since they're a bit pricey, but I did decide to try their flavored lattes. My friend and I ordered a vanilla bean latte and a butterscotch latte. I love coffee shops that use fresh ingredients to flavor their coffee rather than sugary syrups, and that's exactly how they do it at Hollow. The vanilla bean latte had all the delicious flavors of their original latte with the hint of vanilla bean, flavored by what I assume are vanilla bean shavings. The butterscotch however was my favorite. I didn't order it myself because I was worried it'd be too sweet, but I was kicking myself when I tried my friend's. It was delicious! The best butterscotch latte I've ever had! The flavor wasn't too sweet or overly artificial, but enough to fill your tastebuds with that nostalgic butterscotch flavor. 

I recommend all coffee connoisseurs to give hollow a try, you won't regret it!
author: Krystyl C.

description: Stopped by this cute coffee shop on a Saturday morning, and it was pleasantly quiet. Most people came in and ordered their coffee to go, and the staff was very warm and seemed to know many of the people coming through. I ordered an almond milk latte, and it did not disappoint! It was smooth and delicious. I could have drunk three more. I can't wait to go back and try their other drinks.
author: Sonia S.

description: Hollow is the sort of coffee shop that seems to jump out of transdimensional wormhole unexpectedly. Yes, you've passed by that particular intersection a hundred times, but on this day you see it - the tiniest, most adorable little coffee shop ever, tucked into a little green building, beckoning you. I "discovered" this place for myself during a long lunch walk through the north side of GG park. It is a coffee shop for hobbits, but they will let you in, too, and try to explain to you that their little bakery cafe has been there 10 years and didn't just pop out of a wrinkle in spacetime (l know better!). The raftered ceilings are low and cozy, like a ship's galley, and the inside of the building is larger than the outside. Go to Hollow and have an espresso and a house made pastry before it moves on to the neighboring dimension.
author: Aaron A.

description:
Oh, how I loved hollow the first few times I've been! The service is friendly, the coffee is good, and they've got an interesting kick to the matcha (spiced with cinnamon, I believe?). They also have little pastries and goodies (um HELLO empanadas) that are quite tasty as well. 

Unfortunately, we didn't have the greatest of experiences today walking in. Granted it was a holiday so the place was a bit packed when we came in, but we were only the second people in line with one pair of people waiting for their drinks. The barista/worker didn't acknowledge us at all for the 10 minutes we were standing there. I understand that you're busy, but it would be nice to either 1) acknowledge our presence (not even a hello?) or 2) get the drink started when everything is already out. Just felt a little weird as we were awkwardly standing waiting for our coffee which obviously never came (and still no acknowledgement as we walked out)

Totally open to try it out again, but with all the coffee shops with amazing roasts and stellar service, hollow fell a little lower on my list of favorites
author: Jay P.

description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THE VIBE. If I had the funds, I'd move to San Francisco just to sit in this cafe all day. It's a small space, but they've turned it into a cozy, inviting atmosphere. Great little shop to study in, or catch up with a friend. My friends and I tried their housemade vanilla bean latte, regular latte with housemade marshmallow (aka, "TITANIC"), and the housemade hazelnut latte. Their beans have a milder flavor. The housemade marshmallow was denser than the ones you'd find at the supermarket, but still a great addition to the latte. Parking is metered, but there is plenty of parking if you go before noon on a weekday!
author: Brittany H.

description: Ahh! Just love this little quaint, almost easy to miss cafe out near the avenues. In addition to my love of chai, my tastebuds love matcha EVERYTHING. The green matcha latte is a must have while here. It's beautifully prepared with a fancy square marshmallow. Darling ambiance, with Internet, tables/chairs, oh and fancy sink knobs in the bathroom. Details, details.
author: Janelle D.

description: Place was aight. I'm a big coffee guy, so my biggest priority is getting a good, strong coffee. I wasn't too impressed with the coffee here and a bit too pricy, but it was good for what it was worth.
author: David Y.

description: Quaint little coffee place in a place you least expect to find one. Pretty quiet and ample seating space! They also have a good coconut glaze cake!
author: Jay V.

description:
Incredible baked goods, very yummy 
I'm more of a tea drinker and it was nice to see a variety of herbal teas...not just chamomile
author: Jane H.

description:
Most quaint & winsome cafe I've ever encountered.

Drinks: I ordered a large spiced matcha green tea latte and my boyfriend had a mocha. The latte was different than anything I've ever ordered, it was great, but not the greatest. Definitely needed more matcha, I opted for almond milk, so my latte tasted more like a spicy almond milk drink. It was surprisingly thick, not due to the froth, that was interesting. Overall, the spice adds a kick, but I would have definitely preferred more matcha. My boyfriend's mocha was also pretty good, but nothing to write home about. 

Service: The main reason for the four stars, along with ambiance. The baristas were super sweet, friendly and helpful. We aren't big coffee drinkers (I strictly drink tea), so we're a bit ignorant when it comes to ordering coffee. They were super helpful and patient with us... and I truly appreciated that, because the cafe was pretty busy at the time. Great service.

Ambiance: From the colorful exterior to the charming interior... this place is straight out of a movie. The decor is truly to be appreciated, from the chalkboard menus to the vintage seating... take a moment to let the smallest details of this charming place truly sink in. 

Price: I think it's reasonably priced for the area, seems like a better deal to go with the large vs. the small (in my opinion). 

Overall: Okay drinks, great service and amazing ambiance! I'd definitely come back and try more of their drinks and also their empanadas!
author: Astrid Z.

description:
This place is okay. Charming environment, good and knowledgable staff, very small place with limited seating.

Large Titanic II - $8.25
Large butterscotch latte - $5.25
Empanada - $5.25
Grand total: $18.75
For ~$20 I got 2 drinks that were finished in less than half an hour and an empanada that was devoured in 5. 

DRINK REVIEW:
The Titanic II was described to be like a dark chocolate mocha with 4 shots of espresso but my friend said it was basically 4 shots with a subtle hint of chocolate. If you weren't looking for it you wouldn't even know it was there. For this price, not worth. There was so much potential for greatness in this drink, but just like the Titanic and the big marshmallow, it sank.
Butterscotch latte tasted nothing like butterscotch. It tasted like a plain latte with lots of foam. That's all I'll say about that.

The empanada was the most disappointing part of this experience. It was so small and there wasn't enough filling. It was basically the size of an iPhone 5. I want to say it was tasty, but it was gone so fast and honestly not memorable at all. The biscuit was flaky though.

The only reason I gave a 3 instead of a 2 is because of the service.
Sigh. I won't be back here, sorry.
author: Bianca M.

description:
Hollow is an absolutely adorable hole-in-the-wall coffee shop that I've walked past dozens of time, but only recently went into.

Being said, their home-made drinks are forgettable. The boy's matcha latte was powdery and lacked flavor (oddly), and my chai latte was incredibly bland (as well as covered in a thick veil of foam that caused me to scald myself after each sip - that one's my fault, though).

I really don't see why people love this place so much, other than to take pictures for Instagram.
author: Claire S.

description: Super cute spot. Service is always great. Coffee is a bit on the weaker side (for me) but still good and tasty. The pastries and empanadas they offer though are to die for.
author: VM T.

description:
I literally drive pass by this place every time I go to work. 
It's really small! There's not many tables, and it's really cozy inside. They have cute interior as well! Their coffee is good and great service! Will come back again :)
author: Sandy C.

description:
This is the cutest little coffee shop in all of San Francisco.  The shop is painted green with cute lettering in the front, a little planter with flowers, and just cute all over. The inside is small, but also very quaint. I believe that there is seating in the back but I never ventured there.

The selection of drinks and pastries is also unique. They have Guinness cupcakes. They are delicious. I love how soft  and tasty they are. My favorite drink that I  have had from here is the butterscotch latte. It was very creamy and smells great. It really did the trick for me. I've also had the Titanic and matcha latte. Those were good, as well. The Titanic is the one with a huge marshmallow in it, in case you were wondering.
author: Lyra C.

description:
I've been dying to try out this cafe for the longest time, but the distance was always a reason for me to end up not visiting. Tucked away further from downtown, this cafe is a secret haven for coffee lovers. Last week I finally took the time to wake up early and come to Hollow for a cup of coffee. 

The Butterscotch Latte - Amazing. So rich and creamy with a slightly bitter aftertaste. I'm not good at drinking bitter/extremely sweet lattes. This drink is right in between both and was so delicious. I got their marshmallow with it and it tasted amazing.

Spiced Matcha Green Tea Latte - My friend got this drink and I tried it too. Also delicious. Adding spices to a green tea latte was something I thought I wouldn't enjoy. However, it added a new dimension to the green tea latte. Definitely try it out! 

Both drinks were good and the marshmallows they have are A M A Z I N G. Compliments their drinks very well. When I went they didn't have marshmallows on display, but I asked and they had them in the back. So don't be afraid to ask for them!
author: Nancy G.

description: Charming boho style place, with AMAZING bakery items and empenadas, and FANTASTIC  spiced matcha lattes and coffee. It feels so home and welcoming with the folks that we're serving. I wish I could come here every day! Breaks my heart that I live 9 hours away!!!
author: Katie D.

description: I was able to visit this place and it did not disappoint point me at all.  It is a small but cozy little coffee spot. Customer service was phenomenal and the coffee I chose was delicious.  It is a place to catch up with an old friend at and feel super at home.
author: Kathy C.

description:
Such a sweet, tiny little coffee shop. If you are lucky enough to get one of the few seating spots, it is the perfect place to sit with a latte and a friend or book. 

The spiced matcha latte is delicious!
author: Anne S.

description:
Adorable neighborhood coffee shop serving drinks the employees seem proud to make.  Though I didn't love my matcha latte, I think that's more of a reflection on matcha than Hollow coffee.  

Certainly worth a visit, even in SF is saturated with delicious coffee and proud baristas.  It's small, but you can still probably find a seat for just you, or you and a friend.
author: Valerie T.

description: We had wonderful desert and coffees here yesterday.  I'll go out of my way to go here again next time I'm in the city.
author: Ian G.

description: Now my go to coffee shop in SF! Love the vibe and even though the shop is a bit small, the food and desserts make up for it!
author: Megan N.

description: By far the smallest cafe I've ever been to lol but I really appreciated the ambiance and cozy feeling when inside. The latte art was of course beautiful, but I do wish the lattes had more flavor to it. I went here with my friend and I tried the vanilla bean latte while she tried the butterscotch latte. They both tasted like regular plain lattes, yet we hoped they had stronger flavors to them both
author: Monica-Leah A.

description:
Came here to do some studying for finals and was overwhelmingly disappointed. Yes, I understand that the place is small, but in that case that means greet customers when they want to order. I awkwardly waited for five minutes waiting for a barista to help me without any acknowledgement or even a hello.

The coffee was lackluster. I ordered a large vanilla bean latte and their "cooler version of a cinnamon bun," which was actually a scone. I've worked at Starbucks in the past and can say that my latte tasted like an Americano and the vanilla bean flavor was nonexistent until the bottom of the cup. As for the scone, it tasted like butter and was not cinnamon as they claimed. But it looks like the barista at the counter didn't know nor care what pastries they were selling.

Lastly, their tables and seating were as if they were thrifted at a flea market-- I almost spilled my coffee because turns out my table not only tilts but spins! And in terms of square feet, this café is tiny, insofar as the walkway to order is obstructed by the seating arrangements. Other than that, I had to return my used silverware to the barista, because he was too busy conversing with his friend to pay attention to customers. And, legit, the icing on the cake is that there is no wifi! 

I'd rather be at Starbucks after this experience and will not be returning, no matter how boho, hipster, or Coachella this place is. I feel that other Yelpers romanticize this place for its decor, albeit their nonchalant baristas and problematic furnishings.
author: Earl J.

description:
Vibe: This is a small cute little artisan café. Slightly rustic feel. There were a couple small tables in the front as well as some in the back, which is hidden. It doesn't seem too much of a stay and sit though so if you're looking for a place to study this might not be it. 

Drinks: I had a decaf vanilla bean latte with almond milk and thought it was pretty standard. My coffee aficionado friends had a regular vanilla bean latte and a cup of coffee and they weren't too impressed. 

One of the baristas was chopping up some ginger to make their own ginger syrup. It seems like they make their own syrups in general which I love. 

Food: Modest selection of baked goods. Look like they're probably all made in their kitchen or locally. Also they had some artisan chocolates. Pricey but tasty.
author: Michelle Y.

description: This is a small coffee shop located on Irving street south of golden gate park. It has a low roof and seems known for local guests. We ordered three drinks: Vanilla Latte, Cappuccino, and a hot chocolate. All tasted delicious and were at a hot temperature.
author: Billy P.

description: Delicious lattes.  The place is a little bit small, but cozy.  Great place for a quick coffee stop.
author: Karen L.

description: I love this place. Nicest people and innovative drinks. The spiced match almond milk latte is the perfect thing on a cloudy sf day. It's not too far from Lands End, so I usually come here for a latte after a hike.
author: Hayley H.

description:
Cute coffee place with woodsy decor walking distance to Golden Gate Park. My friend loved taking photos here because of how nicely decorated it was. The service was very friendly/sociable. There's a small seating area in the back that sells various cute trinkets.

I ordered a small vanilla bean latte ($4.50). It's fairly sweet and I loved that there were real vanilla beans inside. I've also had the butterscotch latte here and it's equally good. Worth checking out if you're in the area!
author: Linda X.

description: my favorite little hole in the wall coffee shop in SF. Adorable setting, great coffee and big yummy homemade marshmallows :) The twenty four blackbirds mocha is my favorite. Love this place!
author: Kat M.

description:
Hollow is the coolest, cutest, and coziest coffee shop I've been to in SF!! When you go inside, it's almost like stepping into a secret room, away from the city. It's perfect for meeting a friend for coffee and snacks on a cold, drizzly day in SF.

It was a freezing, drizzly afternoon in SF when I came to Hollow. After reviewing the menu, I had a hard time ordering because I wanted to try many items. I ordered the butterscotch latte because it was one of their house-made specialties. I was afraid it was going to be too sweet but it wasn't. It was subtly sweet with just a light taste of sweet and salty butterscotch and espresso. 

I also tried the matcha green tea latte which I didn't quite like. To be fair, I don't like green tea lattes in general (at any coffee shop), so it's not surprising to me. It had a strong matcha and cardamom flavor. If you like green tea lattes, matcha, and cardamom, you might like this latte. 

The vanilla bean latte, one of their other house-made specialties, was deliciously strong, but had a very faint vanilla bean flavor. This might be because it was a large (which comes with two espresso shots), where as the other two were small size (which has one shot). I would have liked a little more vanilla bean flavor in the large latte because the extra espresso shot over powers the vanilla bean taste. This was probably the prettiest of all the lattes though. My favorite out of the three is the butterscotch latte (taste-wise). My friend tried their empanada and liked it.

All the lattes came with beautiful latte art! Everyone at the tables around me were also taking photos of their coffee. The drinks were a tad bit pricey though.  Small butterscotch latte was $4.25, large vanilla bean latte was $5.25. The size of the coffee is pretty small as well. The staff was pretty friendly. There was only one worker when I ordered so the service was a bit slower as she was doing everything (cashiering, preparing drinks and food), but someone came to help later. There is a small room in the back that provides extra seating and has plenty of cute sundries (cards, sweets, kitchen gadgets, etc.) for sale. 

The name Hollow reminds me of a hollow tree trunk, which is kind of what the inside of the store is like. It's a little pricey, but a great place to come for a pretty cup of latte!
author: Jean S.

description:
Super delicious offerings. I love the menu as it's super simple but offers a vast amount of variety. For example, how am I supposed to decide between the Matcha Green Tea Latte (with silky soy milk), the Dark Chocolate Artisan Mocha (with almond milk), the Butterscotch Latte (who cares what milk), or the freshly brewed, french pressed coffee?! Everything sounds good!

The one time I've been here, I tried:
+ Matcha Green Tea Latte (with soy)
+ Dark Chocolate Mocha (with almond milk)
+ French Press Coffee

All of these received an A++ - each was absolutely perfect. I'm critical and I wouldn't offer change to these at all. Plus, the latte art for the "milk" drinks were so pretty!

They even have a wonderful offering of empanadas and croissants that they toast before handing to you. 

My only criticism of this place was the size. It was very small and cramped inside, but not much they can do about that- I feel bad for the baristas working behind an incredibly small counter. How they fit 5 of them back there is a mystery. ;)

To sum it all up: MUST RETURN.
author: Lori T.

description:
I had the hardest time deciding what to order because everything sounded SO good. I usually go with a cappuccino when I go out for coffee, but seeing all their specialties just told me I needed to try something new. After some back and forth chatter with the nicest barista about all the different drinks, I ultimately went with the vanilla bean latte, since I thought the butterscotch would be a little to rich for my liking. And let me tell you, it was perfection in a cup. If you don't like sugary coffee drinks but want something a little more unique, the vanilla bean latte is a great one. 

Had I not come here straight from a huge brunch meal, I would have definitely gotten one of their Guinness cupcakes. I'll definitely be back to get my hands on one of those!!!
author: Sabrina C.

description:
Charming little coffee shop that knows what they're doing with coffee and hot chocolate with homemade marshmallow! The matcha chai latte is quite prominently chai flavored. The cappuccino was very smooth and balanced - not too bitter and drinkable without sugar. They also do a butterscotch latte and a homemade oreo! 

The entrance area has a bit of seating, and there's more in the back. It's not really a working cafe though as I didn't see any outlets and there's no wi-fi. It's great for a pitstop when you need a coffee fix or for sitting and doing some reading.
author: Audrey L.

description:
This a great hole in the wall that serves delicious (and Insta-worthy) coffee. The lighting in the shop gives the place a relaxed, quiet mood.

It's not a huge shop, so don't bring the whole gang here. Instead, just bring one or two friends, or take it to go! The empanadas and the marshmallows are great also!
author: Ian T.

description:
A small and loving environment welcomes you at Hollow. The organic ambiance creates an escape from the suburban sunset district. I myself enjoy environments like this but not for too long. The ceiling was low and I couldn't help but feel a bit enclosed. But sitting by the window and enjoying my vanilla bean soy latte changed my mindset. My friend enjoyed the bench seating against the wall and we sat and talked to our hearts content. 

The vanilla bean soy latte wasn't too sweet with bits of vanilla bean inside. It was smooth and warming to the heart. The soy cappuccino on the other hand, is one of the stronger ones I've ever had. It was robust and hit the right spots. I would come again to try another specialty and maybe a pastry
author: Linda K.

description: Cuttest lil cafe in the sunset! Creative and fair pricings and an alternative vibe like you just waltz into a itty bitty coffee shop. If your here for working it might be a little to small for you but it's perfect for kicking back relaxing and even reading a book!
author: Rokuda R.

description:
Sweet mochas and great ambiance, I'd come back to this little place to meet friends, read a book, or jsut people watch. Their mochas are extra sweet and rich chocolate, if that is what you're into. 

PROS: kind service, fast, delicious, relaxing little hole-in-the-wall
CONS: not cheap (but not expensive)
author: Olivia F.

description:
I was afraid to try Hollow for the longest time because I think spending $4-8 on a 12 ounce drink is akin to robbery. Now, consider me a willing victim.

A 2 shot Americano here is $2.50 (when I first walked in I thought my drink would be $4 based on the menu...but $4 gets you 4 shots!). That's Starbucks prices, guys. And the Americano here is hands down the BEST I have ever had. I've been a fan of Ritual coffee beans for awhile now but not every coffee shop serving them knows how to handle quality beans. Well, the folks at Hollow know what they're doing. My drink was rich and smooth, with floral notes and no acidity. Perfect.

I also got a chance to try their spiced matcha green tea latte with soy milk and it was heavenly. The price was hell but you get what you pay for in this case. I know the next time I want to treat myself good, I'll be coming here and trying out their in-house butterscotch and vanilla bean lattes!

I don't normally rate my cafes based on ambiance, but Hollow delivers in this department too. It's photogenic without being too Kinfolk and I love the woodsy decor and the delicious baked goods on display. There aren't a lot of places to sit in the front but they recently expanded the back so that there is more seating.

Finally, the service is warm and friendly too. None of this hipster vibe/coffee snobbery or credit card only shiz. Just a wonderful--dare I say magical--place to hang out and enjoy your espresso-based drink while nomming on something sweet.

Without a question, the best coffee shop in Inner Sunset.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Hollow looks like your typical San Francisco hole in the wall community coffee shop. It's small, but has a lot of character. 

I come back time after time because of the coffee. Their lattes and mochas are one of the best in the sunset neighborhood (and they are conveniently located near my boyfriend's apartment).

I rated them lower because of their customer service. While they aren't rude, they also aren't friendly. I often walk in and wait at the cashier for quite a while before one of the baristas acknowledges me. 

They are also incredibly disorganized. They open later than most shops, and even then rarely open on time. There will be people waiting outside while they frantically get ready minutes after they were suppose to be open.

I will also hear them tell their customers they are out of ice, syrups, etc. I think overall they could focus on customer service and organization of the business.
author: Kiersten S.

description:
Slo-mo barista has departed the world of Hollow, and the service is now friendly and efficient. The americano is excellent, not bitter. 

Docked a star because you have to navigate around the instagrammers documenting their lattes.
author: J. M.

description:
When I found out that they sell vanilla bean lattes, I was sold! I made my way out here on a random weekday morning. It was nice because it wasn't busy. 

Loved all the vanilla bean in the latte. Asked for it less sweetened and it was perfect!
author: Chris K.

description:
My friend brought me to Hollow since it's his favorite coffeeshop. The storefront is absolutely adorable. Looks like something from a fairytale... or The Hobbit. Everything about the inside of Hollow, including the seating and decor, is also cute in its rustic way. There's additional seating in a back room, where trinkets and chocolates are for sale.

I had a butterscotch latte which was lighter than expected. I wish I had gotten one of the tasty mochas! I tried the sea salted caramel which was the perfect mini snack. The chocolate cupcakes looked irresistible, but I had to resist this time.

Great place to catch up with a friend over a nice cup of coffee or read a book. Not exactly ideal for doing work since there are no outlets or WiFi but I've seen people bring in their laptops. It's a charming coffeeshop in a peaceful neighborhood!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
One of the cutest, hole-in-the-wall coffee shops I've ever been too! Although the store was quite small, it was very comfortable and cozy. Don't expect to find a seat right away considering the shop's size. There were only 3 tiny tables and they were all taken when I got there so I had to get my coffee to go. 

For drinks, I ordered the vanilla bean and my parents ordered the matcha latte. 

Vanilla bean latte: 2.5/5 
I ordered this drink expecting the typical sweet, creamy taste of vanilla but received what roasted pumpkin seed would taste like instead. Because it was hand-made, I was able to taste the crushed solids of the bean in the latte, which would explain the nutty taste of the drink. Despite this unexpected flavor, the taste of the espresso was prominent and smooth. If you're like me and have a huge sweet tooth, I would not recommend this drink. 

Matcha latte: 3.5/5 
My dad is a huge fan of matcha and takes matcha shots every morning in place of coffee for energy in the morning, so when it comes to any food that include this ingredient, he is highly critical of the taste. When he took his first sip of the drink, he was quite disappointed that it did not have the green tea taste he expected. Instead, it tasted more like a chai tea latte, leaving us confused on whether we enjoyed the drink or not because it tasted great (if you're a chai tea fan) but it wasn't what we expected. We didn't realized it was spiced before we ordered the drink but still enjoyed it! It was a fantastic twist to the drink and recommend it anyone who enjoy the comforting, nutty, and soothing taste of chai or any kind of spiced tea! 

Overall, I would definitely visit this coffee shop again and look forward to the next drink to try on their menu :)
author: Priscilla P.

description: My friend and I stumbled upon this cafe while en route to Arizmendi Bakery. We were drawn by the delightful green paint of the store facade and the plants decorating the window. I ordered a latte and it was really good, but not extraordinary. The latte art was very nice though. The coziness and springy feel of the place make it worth a visit. My friend ordered a cortado and loved it.
author: Connie K.

description:
One of the better coffees I have had in San Francisco. Having lived in Europe and Australia for many years, I am extremely picky about my coffee - the aroma of the beans, the density of the milk in comparison with the coffee, the texture, the temperature and the aftertaste. I have settled for this quaint little coffee boutique with a slightly rustic decor after being disappointed varies times with Blue Bottle and Philz Coffee.

Winner: Soy Latte. Pungent, earthy, nut-like aroma. Perfect acidity level. Smooth, velvety and rich texture with a mildly pleasant aftertaste. 

Runner-up: Artisan Dark Chocolate Mocha. Similar to the latte but with a strong shot of chocolate. Perhaps the chocolate was a little too prominent - slightly masking the aroma of the beans.
 
Second Runner-up: Titanic II. A good Saturday afternoon nerding session rescuer - robust bitter-sweet latte topped with a gigantic homemade vanilla bean marshmallow. My only complaint is the price ($8.25 for a large.)

Third Runner-up: Butterscotch Latte. If you have a sweet tooth, this one is for you. I personally prefer my coffee to be more on the piquant side of the intensity spectrum. Unfortunately the texture was lacking - more watery and foamy. The butterscotch was overpowering - more of a sugary beverage, not a pick-me-up coffee. 

Overall thumbs up for this place. Warm and welcoming customer service; awesome barrister; quality coffee that triggered nostalgic memories of my childhood. Will return again soon :)
author: Vega N.

description:
what a hidden gem! I'm happy it is in my neighborhood and will be frequenting more often now. 

the barista was so sweet and she called me sweetie. she had me at hello! I got the large hot chocolate and chocolate chip cookie. both were excellent. the cookie don't have a chew that I usually prefer but no matter. I really wanted to try their homemade marshmallow but they were out and I got the last cookie so don't go too late. I went around 4pm on a weekday. 

the atmosphere was relaxing and warm. love the vintage decor. the neatest thing is their tables and how they spin! Try it next time.
author: Jules L.

description:
I was really excited to try the matcha latte from this place because the reviews seemed favorable and I LOVE matcha so I'm always looking for a new place with matcha lattes. 

The place is teeny, tiny but like everyone says, it's creative, hipster, and very charming. Didn't like that it was so small because it was a little hard to move around and find a place to sit, but nonetheless it was cute and cozy. 

After ordering and trying my drink, I decided that it was all aesthetically pleasing to the eye but unfortunately, I'm not a fan of the spiced matcha latte. :( not enough matcha in my opinion. Most of the matcha powder floated to the top making it seem more green than the actual drink beneath and all I could taste was milk. Given that it might have been a fluke by the person who happened to make my drink that day, I don't think I'll be paying for another matcha latte here. Love the atmosphere, so maybe I'll came back and try something else next time!
author: Christina C.

description: Love this hidden gem in the middle of busy bustling Irving. Wonderful coffee and delicious (sweet) French pastries to pass a lazy afternoon watching the world go by. As part of the decor, indie soaps, candles and perfumes are on display as well for sale, in case you wanted to spend more money while sipping your coffee! There's not much seating so be prepared to take your coffee to go if need be!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Came here while I was wandering around Golden Gate Park. Almost missed it because the storefront is so small! The inside is adorable. Of course, be warned that the coffee here is expensive. We ordered a matcha latte, butterscotch latte, and breakfast empanada. The shop started filling up with people right after we ordered.

The matcha latte was a bit too sweet, but the butterscotch latte was fine (it didn't taste that different from a regular latte). Nice break from the wind and cold outside.
author: Sophie W.

description:
Hollow is a cute/quaint cafe that you can't just miss since the exterior is this forest green color! They offer lattes & snacks that I'm pretty sure that they make (since I've never seen them before in other cafes). Although the space inside is limited and compact, they make it work by adding little wooden circular tables that spin and benches/chairs. This place is affordable with the price of $5 per latte/snack! 

I got the Matcha Green Tea latte. I got to admit, I was pretty surprised by how it tastes because it's so different. I doesn't have a strong matcha smell or taste to it... Instead it has more of a spicy/chai taste to it. The aftertaste is when the matcha actually kicks in. Every time you sip in to the latte, you get this interesting jump to it which made me think it was spicy in a chai way (LOL does that make sense?). My mom got the Vanilla Bean Latte and she said there was nothing bad that she encountered while drinking it. Instead, she said it was pretty good. Their latte art is typical but has more detail than a few latte art places I know. They don't have complicated latte art that amazes you, but this place quite does it if you are looking for a simple (with a little detail) latte art. I'll definitely be back to try their other lattes! (Been hearing a lot of butterscotch latte).
author: Danielle P.

description:
Hollow may just be my new favorite coffee shop in San Francisco.

It's really, really small, but very quaint and quite charming. The staff was friendly, but not overly so, which was fitting for how quiet the cafe was at the time of my arrival. I ordered a soy latte, Spanish chicken empanada, and a slice of the oatmeal cake. All were delicious, reasonably priced, and supplied me with energy for the following adventure at Golden Gate Park.

In addition to coffee and food items, Hollow also sells little trinkets, like tea infusers and salt and pepper shakers. So cute.

I'm already anticipating my next visit and can't wait to try the butterscotch latte. In fact, I'd love to come back one day in the afternoon with only myself and a book!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Wonderful coffee and super delicious empanadas. The design has always caught my eye from the outside, as a passerby for years, and I finally went inside. The interior is so cute and rustic, and actually seats quite a lot of people. Employees were nice, but a unorganized the couple of times I went, even if not busy. Got one drink right away and waited for 10 minutes for the next, only to find the second drink was already done the whole time and they forgot to put it out on the counter. Still excited for another chance to have those empanadas!
author: Nadia D.

description:
Smaller coffee shop than I expected given all of the buzz. I got the Artisan Dark Chocolate coffee. It was good but nothing spectacular. I like the mocha at Spruce and the hot chocolate at Dandelion better. 

Slightly more expensive than other places, a small was $5.50  (seems like the norm is $4 for a small coffee drink elsewhere in the city). 

On the bright side, I did wander around and find the Hidden Garden steps nearby, which was amazing :)
author: Rachel C.

description:
I came here with my dog and significant other - so I wasn't able to enter the building... But the outside looks so cute. I got the match green tea latte which had a subtle taste, but I got more of a pumpkin spice flavor rather than a tea-matcha flavor. Not quite what I was expecting, but that because I didn't read any of the Yelp reviews. 

Significant other got the mocha. It was rich without being overly sweet. I liked it better than the matcha. The small sizes are quite small, but because of the richness of the coffee I was more than satisfied with the volume. 

Good location, cute shop, relaxed and warm feel. Ultimately a good experience. I will be back to try the butterscotch latte and maybe the homemade marshmallow.
author: Catherine H.

description:
I order a poured coffee from Hollow, as a suggestion of a friend. The coffee is really good, the physical atmosphere quaint, but I have to say I didn't feel all that welcome. Normally, my tolerance for bad customer service is very high, but I felt them sizing me up as I walked into the door. 

I really wanted to like it, but reminds me that the old San Franciscan hospitality is gone.
author: Vivian K.

description:
I should've ordered the butterscotch latte but I was craving matcha so I ordered that instead. It's a different type of matcha since its spiced so don't be surprised if it taste different. 

Was hoping for a bigger size small.

Nice cozy environment. Only 3 small tables so I wouldn't recommend studying here.
author: Danae L.

description: Matcha lovers be aware... the spiced matcha latte tastes nothing like matcha. Don't be fooled by the picture. It only tasted like cinnamon to me and agreed by two other friends who tried it as well...:(
author: Mengyuan G.

description:
Hollow is just an hole in the wall. a counter and a few tables for drink-in.

menu: expresso, french pressed coffee, cookies, waffles, pastries, croissants, roast co/ritual coffee.

brew: "ethiopia idido"(roast co.)  french press(3.5)
-strong, herby taste, not bold, acidic nor watery

drips:
-made to order, friendly service
-ritual coffee also served.....
-metered parking in front.
author: Victor G.

description: Incredible atmosphere with limited seating, black coffee was so good, service was okay as the girls were not quietly discussing drama in their lives and were not the friendliest. But I still enjoyed journaling in the corner at the window with my coffee!!
author: Lara H.

description: Overpriced. $5.50 empanadas that you could finish in 3 bites. A cappuccino that's mostly all milk. Pass.
author: Allen P.

description:
Small shop to get away from the typical crowds at Starbucks, Philz, and commercialized coffee shops.

Serving Ritual coffee and titanic hot cocoa.
Good selection of music (jazz).
Metered parking - parking space seems plentiful but only because we came here on a Thursday. Not sure how it is on a weekend.

Price of drinks are typical $$

So if you're looking for a place to hang out with 10 of your friends, party music, and be loud. This is not a place for you.

But if you want alone time and away from the noise; consider this spot.
author: Jared C.

description: I'm in love with this coffee shop and have been a customer for years. I love the owners and the specialty coffee they serve....however today, I watched the grossest things take place. The gentlemen making my coffee (not the usual owners) kept rubbing his nose and then proceeded to sneeze in his hand-twice. Without washing his hands he proceeded to pull espresso and then touch the espresso with his dirty hands. I was the only customer in there and between the text messages he was receiving on his phone and his sneezing it took 10 minutes to receive my coffee. Hollow owners, I'm sad to say that I have no intentions of returning. I had to throw away my favorite latte because I didn't want to contract the nastiness he was hacking up in my latte. I'm so disappointed
author: Megan M.

description: The food here is amazing, and the drinks, albeit bitter, are really pretty. I would come here on a rainy day, it's super cute and relaxing inside. Makes for great instagram pictures! Staff is really nice too.
author: Saleen L.

description:
After a rainy day at the De Young museum, we wanted to head someplace quieter for a tea or coffee. Enter Yelp! 

We took a leisurely walk to Hollow, and are so glad we took a chance on the weather to do so. We didn't stay for too long, just long enough for a delicious rose mint tea and a cappuccino. The girls working were friendly, the place was nicely decorated and clean, and the prices were just right. 

We settled in right by the window to people watch for awhile. It was the perfect place for a change of scenery on a grey day. Even our Uber driver remarked when he came to pick us up "that place looked really cozy". 

It sure was. Thanks Hollow!
author: Brittany B.

description: A little coffee bar with a few tables- cozy with nice natural light through the front windows. Small yet comfortable with quality coffee. Would stop in and take a seat to chat with a friend if interested the area! Pleasant street as well.
author: J K.

description:
Objective: latte in the afternoon.  

Chosen venue: Hollow.

Reasoning: I read that they do butterscotch lattes.  Intrigued.  And I read about their Titanic II.  More intrigued.  

I got a parking spot right smack in front of the entrance.  #meant2be

It was a typical summer afternoon in SF.  Which is exactly like a typical autumn afternoon most everywhere else.  Read: it wasn't exactly sunny, & it wasn't outright grey, but it was chilly.  The test is whether or not I can put the top down.  I did not.  Sucks to be driving your convertible around getting wind blown w cold air.  And I do not like people that drive with the top down when it's cold outside.  #posers.  Don't be one of those people boys & girls.  I also had to leave my jacket on.  Sigh.  But...typical.  And perfect latte weather.

The barista was personable & just a gent.  I ordered a matcha green tea almond latte (what I drink almost daily), a butterscotch almond latte, & a mushroom gorgonzola empanada.  To go, to share w the man.  I was told that their Titanic II is like a meal.  So I opted that out for another time.  Breakfast maybe.

I've said before that I'm a real aesthete.  Hollow is an aesthetes dream come true.
Dare I say perfect?  Yeah.  I'd say Hollow hits every point in spades.  Shabby chic.  Rustic, but elegant.  There's elegance in simplicity.  The colors, the wood...every detail perfectly harmonizes w the others.  Ever been to the restaurant @ Manka's Inverness Lodge (before the fire)?  This is what their cafe would look like if they had one.  Really, the space just begs for a magazine lay out.

The lattes were lukewarm, but I take responsibility for that since I didn't test mine before leaving.  It's also an easy fix.  I tasted the butterscotch & it was wonderfully different.  Because I do matcha lattes almost everyday since about forever, I'm a tough critic there.  This one was good, but was a tad bitter for my taste.  But, that's also an easy fix.

The empanada was delicious.  I vote for a bit more filling, but it was delicious nonetheless.  What other espresso joint can you get homemade empanadas at?  Besides in Spain I mean?!

A tiny sanctuary in our fine city.  Fabulous fabulous place.  
5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
It is impossible to fairly rate Hollow, because it is 5 stars uniqueness, 4 stars menu, 3 stars location, 2 stars seating, and 1 star price.  Before you jump to any Elitist qualms over a 3-star Elite review, I suggest reading the whole review because 1) it is well written and 2) your experience depends on how you weigh different factors.

Hollow is a very quaint coffee shop--"cafe" is not even an appropriate category, as there is no scene of a bustling morning rush hour or UCSF coffee camper students slaving away on laptops.  Stepping from the commercialized Irving street into this nook, you would suspect floo powder to have teleported you into the heart of Diagon Alley.

The ambiance is indeed wicked in many ways.  It almost seems to have sprouted out of the ground or carved out of the woods because the nature theme is so permeating and wholly complete, almost magical.  The furniture is composed of unvarnished wood, the coffee and tea are stowed in metal jars, the treats are on glass platters, imaginative trinkets are everywhere, all the writing is done by hand, it is shrouded in dim twilight lighting, and it is complete with a mysterious unlabeled alcove in the back.  Overall, wickedly awesome.  The lost-place-in-the-middle-of-a-fairytale feeling is further conveyed by the interesting music, which can be considered borderline creepy but adds to the curiosity.  (Omg, is the name derived from the Legend of Sleepy Hollow?!  My mind would be blown if I ever find out I solved this mystery)

So far it sounds either counterculture hipster or very oldschool, right?  Well it's kind of the best of both worlds, because it's whimsical oldschool without a limited oldschool menu, and hipster cool without a hipster snob attitude.  Service was very friendly; the lady took the time to strike up a real conversation so that I wouldn't be awkwardly staring at her make my drink (it's a small place so awkward silences do get awkward, especially with the peculiar background music).  

I love the specialty drinks on the menu, such as the BUTTERSCOTCH LATTE and DARK CHOCOLATE MOCHA.  It takes quite a bit of courage to spend $7.75 on a cup of coffee, but I was fascinated by the TITANIC and decided to splurge to see whether it would be titanic in awesomeness to match the titanic price.  

The titanic is a dark chocolate mocha topped with a house-made marshmallow.
